Links

Links to most frequently used resources for this course:

  • Moodle: To check your grades
  • Piazza: Go to the Q & A tab to post and answer questions related to course materials.
    • You may want to make use of LaTeX equations when you post questions. Below are some links to help you write such equations:
      • Short Math Guide for LaTeX
      • How to LaTeX (note that you should use $…..$ as equation delimiters, not [tex]….[\tex])
  • Videos: Joe Blitzstein (one of the textbook’s authors) recorded his probability lectures in 2011. We may not cover material in exactly the same order, but these videos may be helpful refreshers.
  • Solutions: There are approximately 250 strategic practice problems, with detailed solutions, marked with an “s” in the textbook.
  • Probability Distribution App: An interactive app displaying commonly used discrete and continuous probability distributions. You can also check your work using the probability calculator functionality.
